<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	0.31
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	$
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	0.33
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	$
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	$
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#151;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	$
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	0.32
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=16 VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	oil derivatives are settled based on the month's average daily NYMEX price of West Texas Intermediate Light Sweet Crude Oil.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	natural gas derivatives are settled based on NYMEX natural gas futures, the Northern Natural Gas Co. demarcation price or the Panhandle Eastern Pipe Line spot price of natural gas
	for the calculation period. The basis swap derivatives are settled based on the differential between the NYMEX natural gas futures and the West Texas WAHA index gas price.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	cash settlement price of our basis swaps is calculated on the difference between our natural gas futures contracts that settle on the NYMEX index and the NYMEX index price at the
	time of settlement. At June&nbsp;30, 2012, we had 200,000&nbsp;MMBtu for the remainder of 2012 and 500,000&nbsp;MMBtu for 2013 in basis swaps that did not have corresponding volumes hedged with
	a NYMEX index price. As such, the weighted average price of the basis differential attributable to these volumes has not been included in the weighted average ceiling and floor prices presented above
	as these basis contracts are not expected to settle based on our June&nbsp;30, 2012 hedge positions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(4)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Total
	volume hedged for natural gas basis swaps includes 200,000&nbsp;MMBtu for the remainder of 2012 and 500,000&nbsp;MMBtu for 2013 in basis swaps that did not have
	corresponding volumes hedged with a NYMEX index price at June&nbsp;30, 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=3>
<B>
	Principal components of our cost structure
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Lease operating and natural gas transportation and treating expenses.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;These are daily costs incurred to bring oil and gas out of the ground and to the market,
	together with the daily costs incurred to maintain our producing properties. Such costs also include maintenance, repairs and workover expenses related to our oil and gas properties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	51
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=56,EFW="2211287",CP="LAREDO PETROLEUM HOLDINGS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=287438,FOLIO='51',FILE='DISK130:[12ZCQ1.12ZCQ19101]DI19101A.;38',USER='ANEETZ',CD=';4-OCT-2012;22:12' -->
<A NAME="A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DI19101_1_52">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_BG19101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Production and ad valorem taxes.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Production taxes are paid on produced oil and gas based on a percentage of revenues from products sold at market prices or at
	fixed rates established by federal, state or local taxing authorities. We take full advantage of all credits and exemptions in our various taxing jurisdictions. In general, the production taxes we pay
	correlate to the changes in oil and gas revenues. Ad valorem taxes are property taxes assessed based on a flat rate per oil or natural gas equivalent produced on our properties located in Texas.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Drilling rig fees.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;These are costs incurred under short-term drilling contracts for fees paid to various third parties if we terminate our drilling or
	cease efforts, including for stacked drilling rigs in lieu of drilling.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Drilling and production.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;These are costs incurred to maintain facilities that support our drilling activities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	General and administrative.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;These are costs incurred for overhead, including payroll and benefits for our corporate staff, costs of maintaining our headquarters,
	costs of managing our production and development operations, franchise taxes, audit and other fees for professional services and legal compliance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Equity and stock-based compensation.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;These are costs incurred for compensation expense related to employee unit awards granted prior to December&nbsp;19, 2011
	and employee stock awards granted on or after December&nbsp;19, 2011, which have been recognized on a straight-line basis over the vesting period associated with the award.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Depreciation, depletion and amortization.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the full cost accounting method, we capitalize costs within a cost center and then systematically expense those
	costs on a units of production basis based on proved oil and natural gas reserve quantities. We calculate depletion on the following types of costs: (i)&nbsp;all capitalized costs, other than the
	cost of investments in unproved properties and major development projects for which proved reserves cannot yet be assigned, less accumulated amortization; (ii)&nbsp;the estimated future expenditures
	to be incurred in developing proved reserves; and (iii)&nbsp;the estimated dismantlement and abandonment costs, net of estimated salvage values. We calculate depreciation on the cost of fixed assets
	related to our pipelines and other fixed assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Impairment expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This is the cost to reduce proved oil and gas properties to the calculated full cost ceiling value and the write-downs of our materials and
	supplies inventory, consisting of pipe and well equipment, to the lower of cost or market value at the end of the respective period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=3>
<B>
	Other income (expense)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Realized and unrealized gain (loss) on commodity derivative financial instruments.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We utilize commodity derivative financial instruments to reduce our exposure to
	fluctuations in the price of crude oil and natural gas. This amount represents (i)&nbsp;the recognition of unrealized gains and losses associated with our open derivative contracts as commodity
	prices change and commodity derivative contracts expire or new ones are entered into, and (ii)&nbsp;our realized gains and losses on the settlement of these commodity derivative instruments. We
	classify these gains and losses as operating activities in our consolidated statements of cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	52
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=57,EFW="2211287",CP="LAREDO PETROLEUM HOLDINGS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=99049,FOLIO='52',FILE='DISK130:[12ZCQ1.12ZCQ19101]DI19101A.;38',USER='ANEETZ',CD=';4-OCT-2012;22:12' -->
<A NAME="A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DI19101_1_53">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_BG19101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Realized and unrealized gain (loss) on interest rate derivative instruments.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We utilize interest rate swaps and caps to reduce our exposure to fluctuations in
	interest rates on our outstanding debt. This amount represents (i)&nbsp;the recognition of unrealized gains and losses associated with our open interest rate derivative contracts as interest rates
	change and interest rate contracts expire or new ones are entered into, and (ii)&nbsp;our realized gains and losses on the settlement of these interest rate contracts. We classify these gains and
	losses as operating activities in our consolidated statements of cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Interest expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We finance a portion of our working capital requirements, capital expenditures and acquisitions with borrowings under our senior secured credit
	facility, our senior unsecured notes and, prior to its termination on July&nbsp;1, 2011, the Broad Oak credit facility. As a result, we incur interest expense that is affected by both fluctuations
	in interest rates and our financing decisions. We have entered into various interest rate derivative contracts to mitigate the effects of interest rate changes. We do not designate these derivative
	contracts as hedges; therefore, hedge accounting treatment is not applicable. Realized and unrealized gains or losses on these interest rate contracts are included in
	non-operating income (expense) as discussed above. We reflect interest paid to the lenders and bondholders in interest expense. In addition, we include the amortization of deferred
	financing costs (including origination and amendment fees), commitment fees and annual agency fees in interest expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Interest and other income.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This represents the interest received on our cash and cash equivalents as well as other miscellaneous income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Income tax expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Income taxes in our financial statements are generally presented on a "consolidated" basis. However, in light of the historic ownership
	structure of Laredo, U.S. tax laws do not allow tax losses of one entity to offset income and losses of another entity until after the consummation of the Broad Oak acquisition on July&nbsp;1, 2011.
	As such, the financial accounting for the income tax consequences of each taxable entity is calculated separately for all periods prior to July&nbsp;1, 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Laredo
	Petroleum Holdings, Inc. and its subsidiaries are subject to federal and state corporate income taxes. These income taxes are accounted for under the asset and liability method. Deferred tax
	assets and liabilities are recognized for the future tax consequences attributable to differences between the financial statement carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities and their
	respective tax bases and operating losses and tax credit carry-forwards. Under this method, deferred tax assets and liabilities are measured using enacted tax rates expected to apply to taxable income
	in the years in which those temporary differences are expected to be recovered or settled. The effect on deferred tax assets and liabilities of a change in tax rates is recognized in income in the
	period that includes the enactment date. On a quarterly basis, management evaluates the need for and adequacy of valuation allowances based on the expected realization of the deferred tax assets and
	adjusts the amount of such allowances, if necessary.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	53
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;MBbl
	equivalents ("MBOE") are calculated using a conversion rate of six MMcf per one MBbl.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	volumes presented are based on actual results and are not calculated using the rounded numbers presented in the table above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Realized
	crude oil and natural gas prices are the actual prices realized at the wellhead after all adjustments for NGL content, quality, transportation fees, geographical
	differentials, marketing bonuses or deductions and other factors affecting the price at the wellhead.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(4)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Hedged
	prices reflect the after effect of our commodity hedging transactions on our average sales prices. Our calculation of such after effects include realized gains and losses on
	cash settlements for commodity derivatives, which do not qualify for hedge accounting. See Note&nbsp;G.4 to our audited consolidated financial statements and Note&nbsp;F.4 to our unaudited
	consolidated financial statements included elsewhere in this prospectus for additional information regarding our realized gains and losses on commodity derivatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(5)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General
	and administrative includes non-cash, stock-based compensation of $4.8&nbsp;million and $0.9&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 and
	2011, respectively, and $6.1&nbsp;million, $1.3&nbsp;million and $1.4&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2011, 2010 and 2009, respectively. Excluding stock-based compensation
	from the above metric results in average general and administrative cost per BOE of $5.02 and $4.73 for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 and 2011, respectively, and $5.19, $5.69 and $5.94 for
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2011, 2010 and 2009, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	54
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Oil and natural gas revenues.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our oil and natural gas revenues increased by approximately $52.0&nbsp;million, or 22%, to $288.6&nbsp;million during the six
	months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 as compared to the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2011. Our revenues are a function of oil and natural gas production volumes sold and average sales prices received
	for those volumes. Average daily production sold increased by 7,620 BOE/D during the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 as compared to the same period in 2011. The total increase in revenue of
	approximately $52.0&nbsp;million is largely attributable to higher oil and natural gas production volumes for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 as compared to the six months ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2011. Production increased by 714 MBbls for oil and 4,168 MMcf for natural gas for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 as compared to the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2011.
	The net dollar effect of the
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	55
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	decrease
	in prices of approximately $41.5&nbsp;million (calculated as the change in period-to-period average prices times current year-to-date
	production volumes for oil and natural gas) and the net dollar effect of the increase in production of approximately $93.6&nbsp;million (calculated as the increase in
	period-to-period volumes for oil and natural gas times the prior period average prices) are shown below.
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prices
	shown are realized, unhedged $/Bbl for oil and are realized, unhedged $/Mcf for natural gas.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Production
	volumes are presented in MBbls for oil and in MMcf for natural gas.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Lease operating expenses.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lease operating expenses, which include workover expenses, increased to $30.6&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30,
	2012 from $18.1&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2011, an increase of approximately 69%. The increase was primarily due to an increase in drilling activity, which resulted in
	additional producing wells during the first six months of 2012 compared to the same period in 2011. The increase in well count also led to increases in routine repairs and maintenance. Additionally, a
	portion of the increase is due to approximately $1.1&nbsp;million in additional workover expenses incurred during the first six months of 2012 as compared to the same period in 2011 resulting
	largely from costs incurred for the workover of one well. This workover is not indicative of costs typically incurred for workovers and was fully completed in the first quarter of 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On
	a per-BOE basis, lease operating expenses increased in total to $5.67 per BOE for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 from $4.53 per BOE for the six months ended June&nbsp;30,
	2011. Excluding the one-time workover expense noted above, lease operating expense per BOE at June&nbsp;30, 2012 was $5.44 per BOE.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Production and ad valorem taxes.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Production and ad valorem taxes increased to approximately $16.2&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 from
	$15.0&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2011, an increase of 8%. This increase was primarily due to the
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	56
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=61,EFW="2211287",CP="LAREDO PETROLEUM HOLDINGS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=292846,FOLIO='56',FILE='DISK130:[12ZCQ1.12ZCQ19101]DJ19101A.;27',USER='ANEETZ',CD=';4-OCT-2012;22:12' -->
<A NAME="A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DJ19101_1_57">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_BG19101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	significant
	increase in production of approximately 1,409 MBOE, or 35%, for the first six months of 2012 as compared to the same period in 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Drilling and production.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Drilling and production costs increased to approximately $1.8&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 from
	$0.7&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2011 as a result of increased maintenance costs related to the increase in drilling during the first six months of 2012 as compared to the
	same period in 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	General and administrative ("G&amp;A").
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;G&amp;A expense increased to approximately $31.9&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 from
	$19.8&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2011, an increase of $12.1&nbsp;million, or 61%. Increases in salaries, benefits and bonuses accounted for approximately
	$6.3&nbsp;million of the increase due to the payment of performance bonuses totaling $2.0&nbsp;million in February 2012 as well as an increase in the number of employees as we continue to grow our
	business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Additionally,
	stock-based compensation increased by approximately $4.0&nbsp;million to $4.8&nbsp;million for the first six months of 2012 as compared to the same period in 2011 due to the issuance
	of 776,711 restricted stock awards and 602,948 non-qualified stock options during 2012. The fair value of the restricted stock awards issued during the first and second quarters of 2012
	was calculated based on the value of our stock price on the date of grant in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles in the United States of America ("GAAP") and is being recognized
	on a straight-line basis over the three year requisite service period of the awards. The fair value of our non-qualified restricted stock options was determined using a
	Black-Scholes valuation model in accordance with applicable GAAP accounting and is being recognized on a straight-line basis over the four year requisite service period of the awards. The
	issuance of our cash-settled performance unit liability awards in February 2012, which are revalued at the end of each reporting period using a Monte Carlo simulation, accounted for
	approximately $1.0&nbsp;million of the total change for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 as compared to the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On
	a per-BOE basis, G&amp;A expense increased to $5.91 per BOE during the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 from $4.95 per BOE for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2011. Excluding
	non-cash, stock-based compensation, G&amp;A expense per BOE was $5.02 and $4.73 for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 and 2011, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	See
	Notes&nbsp;B and D to our unaudited consolidated financial statements included elsewhere in this prospectus for additional information regarding our stock and performance based compensation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Depreciation, depletion and amortization ("DD&amp;A").
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DD&amp;A increased to approximately $112.2&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 from
	$75.9&nbsp;million for the six months
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	57
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=62,EFW="2211287",CP="LAREDO PETROLEUM HOLDINGS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=278196,FOLIO='57',FILE='DISK130:[12ZCQ1.12ZCQ19101]DJ19101A.;27',USER='ANEETZ',CD=';4-OCT-2012;22:12' -->
<A NAME="A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DJ19101_1_58">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_BG19101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2011, an increase of $36.3&nbsp;million, or 48%. The following table provides components of our DD&amp;A expense for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 and 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_24"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The increase in depletion of proved oil and natural gas properties of $35.5&nbsp;million and the increase in the depletion rate of $1.76 per BOE resulted
	primarily from (i)&nbsp;increased net book value on new reserves added, (ii)&nbsp;higher total production levels and (iii)&nbsp;increased capitalized costs for new wells completed in 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Impairment expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Impairment expense decreased to zero for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 from $0.2&nbsp;million for the six months ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2011. Impairment expense incurred in the first six months of 2011 was to reflect our materials and supplies inventory at the lower of cost or market value calculated as of
	June&nbsp;30, 2011. It was determined at June&nbsp;30, 2012 that a lower of cost or market value adjustment was not needed for materials and supplies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	evaluate the impairment of our oil and natural gas properties on a quarterly basis according to the full cost method prescribed by the SEC. If the carrying amount exceeds the calculated full cost
	ceiling, we reduce the carrying amount of the oil and natural gas properties to the calculated full cost ceiling amount, which is determined to be the estimated fair value. At June&nbsp;30, 2012 and
	2011, it was determined that our oil and natural gas properties were not impaired.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Commodity derivative financial instruments.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Due to the inherent volatility in oil and natural gas prices, we use commodity derivative instruments, including puts,
	swaps, collars and basis swaps to hedge price risk associated with a significant portion of our anticipated oil and natural gas production. At each period end, we estimate the fair value of our
	commodity derivatives using a valuation prepared by an independent third party and recognize an unrealized gain or loss. We have not elected hedge accounting on these derivatives, and therefore, the
	unrealized gains and losses on open positions are reflected in current earnings. For the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 and 2011, our commodity derivatives resulted in a realized gain of
	$13.8&nbsp;million and a realized loss of $0.9&nbsp;million, respectively. For the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 and 2011, our commodity derivatives resulted in an unrealized gain of
	$15.3&nbsp;million and an unrealized loss of $8.7&nbsp;million, respectively. At June&nbsp;30, 2012, we had 18 commodity derivatives contracts with associated deferred premiums totaling
	approximately $27.5&nbsp;million. The estimated fair value of our total deferred premiums was approximately $23.6&nbsp;million at June&nbsp;30, 2012. The fair market value of these premiums is
	deducted from our unrealized gain or loss at each period end.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	58
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Interest expense and realized and unrealized gains and losses on interest rate swaps.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest
	expense increased to approximately $36.4&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 from $22.3&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2011, largely due to the
	issuance of our $350.0&nbsp;million and $200.0&nbsp;million 2019 senior unsecured notes in January 2011 and October of 2011, respectively, as well as the issuance of our $500.0&nbsp;million 2022
	senior unsecured notes in April of 2012 as shown in the table below.
</FONT>
</P>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	term loan was entered into on July&nbsp;7, 2010 and was paid-in-full and terminated on January&nbsp;20, 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Broad Oak credit facility was paid-in-full and terminated on July&nbsp;1, 2011 in connection with the Broad Oak acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest
	rates presented are annual rates which have been prorated to reflect the portion of the year for which they have been incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We have entered into certain variable-to-fixed interest rate swaps that hedge our exposure to interest rate variations on our variable
	interest rate debt. At June&nbsp;30, 2012, we had interest rate swaps outstanding for a notional amount of $100.0&nbsp;million with fixed pay rates ranging from 1.11% to 3.00% and terms expiring
	through September 2013. At June&nbsp;30, 2011, we had interest rate swaps outstanding for a notional amount of $260.0&nbsp;million with fixed pay rates ranging from 1.11% to 3.41% and terms
	expiring through September 2013. We realized losses on interest rate swaps of $1.9&nbsp;million and $2.6&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 and 2011, respectively.
	Additionally, we recorded unrealized gains on interest rate swaps of $1.6&nbsp;million and $1.5&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 and June&nbsp;30, 2011, respectively.
	At June&nbsp;30, 2012, the estimated fair value of our interest rate swaps was in a net liability position of $0.4&nbsp;million compared to a net liability position of $2.0&nbsp;million at
	December&nbsp;31, 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Income tax expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We recorded a deferred income tax expense of $32.2&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012, compared to a deferred income
	tax expense of $25.7&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2011. The estimated annual effective tax rate was 36% for each of the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 and 2011. Our
	effective tax rate is based on our estimated annual permanent tax differences and estimated annual pre-tax book income. Our estimates involve assumptions we believe to be reasonable at the
	time of the estimation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	59
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Oil and gas revenues.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our oil and gas revenues increased by approximately $266.5&nbsp;million, or 111%, to $506.3&nbsp;million during the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2011 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010. Our revenues are a function of oil and gas production volumes sold and average sales prices received for those volumes.
	Average daily production sold increased by 9,431&nbsp;BOE/D during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011 as compared to the same period in 2010.
	The total increase in revenue of approximately $266.5&nbsp;million is largely attributable to higher oil and gas production volumes as well as an increase in oil prices being realized for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2011 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010. Production increased by 1,720&nbsp;MBbls for oil and 10,330&nbsp;MMcf for gas for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31,
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	60
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=65,EFW="2211287",CP="LAREDO PETROLEUM HOLDINGS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=1035240,FOLIO='60',FILE='DISK130:[12ZCQ1.12ZCQ19101]DK19101A.;42',USER='ANEETZ',CD=';4-OCT-2012;22:12' -->
<A NAME="A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DK19101_1_61">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_BG19101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2011
	as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010. The net dollar effect of the increase in prices of approximately $79.5&nbsp;million (calculated as the change in
	year-to-year average prices times current year production volumes for oil and gas) and the net dollar effect of the change in production of approximately $187.0&nbsp;million
	(calculated as the increase in year-to-year volumes for oil and gas times the prior year average prices) are shown below.
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prices
	shown are realized, unhedged $/Bbl for oil and are realized, unhedged $/Mcf for natural gas.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Production
	volumes are presented in MBbls for oil and in MMcf for natural gas.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Natural gas transportation and treating.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our revenues related to natural gas transportation and treating increased by $1.8&nbsp;million during the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2011 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010. This increase was due to the sale of oil condensate from our pipeline assets during 2011, which occurs on an infrequent
	basis, as well as an increase in the volumes transported through our pipeline.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Lease operating expenses.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lease operating expenses, which include workover expenses, increased to $43.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011
	from $21.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, an increase of approximately 100%. The increase was primarily due to an increase in drilling activity, which resulted in
	additional producing wells during 2011 compared to 2010. On a per-BOE basis, lease operating expenses increased in total to $5.00 per BOE at December&nbsp;31, 2011 from $4.16 per BOE at
	December&nbsp;31, 2010. The majority of the increase is due to approximately $3.5&nbsp;million in additional workover expenses incurred during 2011 as compared to the same period in 2010 as market
	conditions for oil and gas became more favorable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Production and ad valorem taxes.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Production and ad valorem taxes increased to approximately $32.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011 from
	$15.7&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2010, an increase of $16.3&nbsp;million, or approximately 104%, primarily due to the increase in market prices (not including the effects of hedging), as well as a
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	61
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=66,EFW="2211287",CP="LAREDO PETROLEUM HOLDINGS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=1005599,FOLIO='61',FILE='DISK130:[12ZCQ1.12ZCQ19101]DK19101A.;42',USER='ANEETZ',CD=';4-OCT-2012;22:12' -->
<A NAME="A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DK19101_1_62">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_BG19101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	significant
	increase in production for 2011 as compared to the same period in 2010. The average realized prices excluding derivatives for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011 were $91.00 per Bbl
	for oil and $6.30 per Mcf for gas as compared to $77.00 per Bbl for oil and $5.28 per Mcf for gas for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Drilling and production.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Drilling and production costs increased to approximately $3.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011 from
	$0.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 as a result of increased maintenance costs related to the increase in drilling during 2011 as compared to 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	General and administrative ("G&amp;A").
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;G&amp;A expense increased to approximately $51.1&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2011 from $30.9&nbsp;million at
	December&nbsp;31, 2010, an increase of $20.2&nbsp;million, or 65%. Increases in professional fees incurred relating to the issuance of the 2019 senior unsecured notes, the Broad Oak acquisition,
	the filing of a registration statement relating to the 2019 senior unsecured notes with the SEC and other matters accounted for approximately $7.4&nbsp;million, or 37%, of the change in G&amp;A, as well
	as approximately $7.2&nbsp;million in additional salary, benefits and bonus expenditures due to the Broad Oak acquisition and the growth of our business and employee base.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Equity
	and stock-based compensation increased to approximately $6.1&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2011 from $1.3&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2010, an increase of approximately
	$4.8&nbsp;million. Approximately $4.1&nbsp;million of this increase was attributed largely to new series of units issued in conjunction with the Broad Oak acquisition in the third quarter of 2011.
	On December&nbsp;19, 2011, as a result of our Corporate Reorganization, the outstanding units in Laredo Petroleum, LLC that had been previously issued to management, directors and employees were
	exchanged for 2,500,807 vested and 912,038 unvested shares of common stock in Laredo Petroleum Holdings, Inc. The fair value of the unit awards immediately prior to the exchange was determined to be
	equal to the fair value of the common shares immediately after the exchange and as such, the basis in the former unvested units was carried over to the unvested
	shares of common stock. This resulted in no additional incremental compensation cost being recognized at the date of conversion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On
	a per-BOE basis, G&amp;A expense decreased to $5.90 per BOE during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011 from $5.93 per BOE during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010. This decrease
	was a result of a significant increase in production during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010. Additionally, on a per-BOE
	basis, excluding the costs of the Broad Oak acquisition, G&amp;A expense was approximately $4.22 per BOE for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	have a 2011 Omnibus Equity Incentive Plan, which allows for the issuance of restricted stock awards, stock options and performance units to current and prospective directors, officers, employees,
	consultants and advisors. There were no issuances under the plan of restricted stock awards, stock options or performance units during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011. In February 2012, we
	issued 593,939 restricted stock awards, 602,948 stock options and 49,244 performance units to employees and officers and will record compensation expense related to these issuances in accordance with
	GAAP in future periods. See Note&nbsp;O to our audited consolidated financial statements included elsewhere in this prospectus for additional information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	62
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

	December&nbsp;31, 2010, an increase of $79.0&nbsp;million, or 81%. The following table provides components of our DD&amp;A expense for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2011 and 2010.

</FONT>

<FONT SIZE=2>

<FONT SIZE=2>

<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;" VALIGN="TOP">

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	increase in depletion of proved oil and natural gas properties of $77.7&nbsp;million and the increase in the depletion rate of $1.82 per BOE resulted primarily from (i)&nbsp;increased net book
	value on new reserves added, (ii)&nbsp;higher total production levels, (iii)&nbsp;increased capitalized costs for new wells completed in 2011 and (iv)&nbsp;a corresponding offset caused by the
	increase in oil and natural gas prices between periods used to calculate proved reserves.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	increase in depreciation for pipeline and gas gathering assets of $0.5&nbsp;million was primarily due to the expansion of our gas gathering system.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	increase in depreciation for other fixed assets of $0.8&nbsp;million was primarily due to an increase in fixed asset additions as we continued to grow our business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Impairment expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Impairment expense increased to $0.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011 from zero for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2010. This increase is due to a write-down of our materials and supplies inventory to reflect the balance at the lower of cost or market value calculated as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2011. It was determined at December&nbsp;31, 2010 that a lower of cost or market adjustment was not needed for materials and supplies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	evaluate the impairment of our oil and gas properties on a quarterly basis according to the full cost method prescribed by the SEC. If the carrying amount exceeds the calculated full cost ceiling,
	we reduce the carrying amount of the oil and gas properties to the calculated full cost ceiling amount, which is determined to be their estimated fair value. For the years ended December&nbsp;31,
	2011 and 2010, it was determined that our oil and gas properties were not impaired.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Commodity derivative financial instruments.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Due to the inherent volatility in oil and gas prices, we use commodity derivative instruments, including puts, swaps,
	collars and basis swaps to hedge price risk associated with a significant portion of our anticipated oil and gas production. At each period end, we estimate the fair value of our commodity derivatives
	and recognize an unrealized gain or loss. We have not elected hedge accounting on these derivatives, and therefore, the unrealized gains and losses on open positions are reflected in current earnings.
	For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2011 and 2010, our commodity derivatives resulted in realized gains of $3.7&nbsp;million and $22.7&nbsp;million, respectively. For the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2011 and 2010, our commodity derivatives resulted in an unrealized gain of
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	63
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=68,EFW="2211287",CP="LAREDO PETROLEUM HOLDINGS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=773626,FOLIO='63',FILE='DISK130:[12ZCQ1.12ZCQ19101]DK19101A.;42',USER='ANEETZ',CD=';4-OCT-2012;22:12' -->
<A NAME="A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DK19101_1_64">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_BG19101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	$17.3&nbsp;million
	and an unrealized loss of $11.5&nbsp;million, respectively. During the fourth quarter ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 and the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 2011, we
	entered into a number of new commodity derivatives of which twelve had associated deferred premiums totaling approximately $19.8&nbsp;million. The estimated fair value of our total deferred premiums
	was approximately $18.9&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2011. The fair market value of these premiums is deducted from our unrealized gains at December&nbsp;31, 2011. The overall gain at
	December&nbsp;31, 2011 is largely due to the decrease in market prices to levels lower than those specified in our fixed price commodity derivative contracts during the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Interest expense and realized and unrealized gains and losses on interest rate swaps.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest expense increased to approximately $50.6&nbsp;million for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2011 from $18.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, largely due to higher weighted average interest rates and higher weighted average outstanding debt
	balances on our senior secured credit facility and due to the issuance of the 2019 senior unsecured notes during 2011 as compared to 2010 as shown in the table below. Additionally, we had
	approximately $3.5&nbsp;million in amortized deferred loan costs and $0.7&nbsp;million in other fees and deferred option premium amortization that were charged to interest expense for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2011 as compared to $2.0&nbsp;million in amortized deferred loan costs and $0.4&nbsp;million in other fees and deferred option premium amortization for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2010.
</FONT>
</P>

</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=13 VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	term loan was entered into on July&nbsp;7, 2010 and was paid-in-full and terminated on January&nbsp;20, 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Broad Oak credit facility was paid-in-full and terminated on July&nbsp;1, 2011 in connection with the Broad Oak acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During 2010, we entered into certain variable-to-fixed interest rate swaps that hedge our exposure to interest rate variations on our
	variable interest rate debt. At December&nbsp;31, 2011, we had interest rate swaps outstanding for a notional amount of $260.0&nbsp;million with fixed pay rates ranging from 1.11% to 3.41% and
	terms expiring through September 2013. At December&nbsp;31, 2010, we had interest rate swaps outstanding for a notional amount of $300.0&nbsp;million with fixed pay rates ranging from 1.11% to
	3.41% and terms expiring through September 2013. We realized losses on interest rate swaps of $4.9&nbsp;million and $5.2&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2011 and 2010,
	respectively. Additionally, we recorded an unrealized gain on interest rate swaps of $3.6&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2011 compared to an unrealized loss of $0.1&nbsp;million at
	December&nbsp;31, 2010. At December&nbsp;31, 2011, the estimated fair value of our interest rate swaps was in a net liability position of $2.0&nbsp;million compared to a net liability position
	of $5.5&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Write-off of deferred loan costs.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In January 2011, we used a portion of the net proceeds from the issuance of the 2019 senior unsecured notes to pay in
	full and retire our term loan. Additionally, concurrent with the issuance of the 2019 senior unsecured notes, the borrowing base on our senior secured credit facility was lowered from
	$220.0&nbsp;million to $200.0&nbsp;million. As a result, we took a charge to expense for the debt issuance costs attributable to our term loan
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	64
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=69,EFW="2211287",CP="LAREDO PETROLEUM HOLDINGS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=514812,FOLIO='64',FILE='DISK130:[12ZCQ1.12ZCQ19101]DK19101A.;42',USER='ANEETZ',CD=';4-OCT-2012;22:12' -->
<A NAME="A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DK19101_1_65">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_BG19101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
	a proportionate percentage of the costs incurred for our senior secured credit facility, which totaled $2.9&nbsp;million and $0.3&nbsp;million, respectively. As of December&nbsp;31, 2011,
	the borrowing base on our senior secured credit facility is $712.5&nbsp;million. On July&nbsp;1, 2011, in connection with the Broad Oak acquisition, the Broad Oak credit facility was paid in full
	and terminated, and the related debt issuance costs of $2.9&nbsp;million were charged to expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Income tax expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We prepared separate tax returns for Laredo Petroleum, LLC, Laredo Petroleum, Inc. and Broad Oak for the period prior to July&nbsp;1, 2011.
	We recorded a deferred income tax expense of $59.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011, compared to a deferred income tax benefit of $25.8&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2010. The
	estimated annual effective tax rates were 36% and 37% for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2011 and 2010, respectively; however, during the first nine months of 2010, Broad Oak had a valuation
	allowance against its net deferred federal tax asset which decreased our deferred income tax expense for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010. Our effective tax rate is based on our estimated
	annual permanent tax differences and estimated annual pre-tax book income. Our estimates involve assumptions we believe to be reasonable at the time of the estimation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	65
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Oil and gas revenues.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our oil and gas revenues increased by approximately $145.4&nbsp;million, or 154%, to approximately $239.8&nbsp;million during the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009. Our revenues are a function of oil and gas production volumes sold and average sales prices received for those
	volumes. Average daily production
	sold increased by 4,516&nbsp;BOE/D during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009. The total increase in revenue of approximately
	$145.4&nbsp;million is largely attributable to an increase in oil and gas production volumes as well as an increase in oil and gas prices realized for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 as
	compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009. Production increased by 1,135&nbsp;MBbls for oil and by 3,079&nbsp;MMcf for
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	66
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=71,EFW="2211287",CP="LAREDO PETROLEUM HOLDINGS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=919893,FOLIO='66',FILE='DISK130:[12ZCQ1.12ZCQ19101]DK19101A.;42',USER='ANEETZ',CD=';4-OCT-2012;22:12' -->
<A NAME="A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DK19101_1_67">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_BG19101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	gas
	during 2010 as compared to 2009. The net dollar effect of the increase in prices of approximately $68.3&nbsp;million (calculated as the change in year-to-year average
	prices times current year production volumes for oil and gas) and the net dollar effect of the change in production of approximately $77.1&nbsp;million (calculated as the change in
	year-to-year volumes for oil and gas times the prior year average prices) are shown below.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_32"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prices
	shown are realized, unhedged $/Bbl for oil and are realized, unhedged $/Mcf for gas.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;LINE-HEIGHT:9PT;">
	(2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Production
	volumes are presented in MBbls for oil and in MMcf for natural gas.
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Lease operating expenses.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lease operating expenses increased to approximately $21.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 from
	$12.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, an increase of 74%, primarily due to the increase in the number of owned properties during 2010 as compared to 2009. On a
	per-BOE basis, lease operating expenses increased in total to $4.16 per BOE at December&nbsp;31, 2010 from $3.52 per BOE at December&nbsp;31, 2009. This increase was largely a result
	of lower production for the first nine months of 2010 as we scaled back our drilling program in response to lower oil and gas prices, while continuing to incur lease operating expenses on properties
	with normal declining production.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Production and ad valorem taxes.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Production and ad valorem taxes increased to approximately
	$15.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 from $6.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, an increase of $9.6&nbsp;million, or 157%, primarily due to the
	increase in market prices (not including the effects of hedging) for 2010 as compared to 2009. The average realized prices excluding derivatives for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 were $77.00
	per Bbl for oil and $5.28 per Mcf for natural gas as compared to $58.37 per Bbl for oil and $3.52 per Mcf for natural gas for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Drilling rig fees.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have committed to several short-term drilling contracts with various third parties to complete our drilling projects. The
	contracts contain an early termination clause that requires us to pay significant penalties to the third parties if we cease drilling efforts. For the
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	67
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=72,EFW="2211287",CP="LAREDO PETROLEUM HOLDINGS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=946397,FOLIO='67',FILE='DISK130:[12ZCQ1.12ZCQ19101]DK19101A.;42',USER='ANEETZ',CD=';4-OCT-2012;22:12' -->
<A NAME="A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DK19101_1_68">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_BG19101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, we incurred approximately $1.6&nbsp;million in stacked rig fees. In 2010, we did not incur any stacked rig fees related to our drilling rig contracts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Drilling and production.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Drilling and production costs decreased to approximately $0.3&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2010 from $0.8&nbsp;million at
	December&nbsp;31, 2009 as a result of improved cost control measures related to our activities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	General and administrative ("G&amp;A").
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;G&amp;A expense increased to approximately $30.9&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2010 from $22.6&nbsp;million at
	December&nbsp;31, 2009, an increase of $8.3&nbsp;million, or 37%. Increases in salaries, benefits and bonus expense (net of capitalized salary and benefits) accounted for approximately
	$5.4&nbsp;million, or 64%, of the change in G&amp;A expense as we continued to grow our employee base during 2010. Equity and stock-based compensation decreased to approximately $1.3&nbsp;million at
	December&nbsp;31, 2010 from $1.4&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2009 due largely to a lower average grant date fair value and number of awards granted and vested during 2010 as compared to
	2009. The remainder of the increase largely consisted of additional expenditures for technology, travel costs and professional fees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On
	a per-BOE basis, G&amp;A expense decreased to $5.93 per BOE during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 from $6.34 per BOE at December&nbsp;31, 2009. This decrease was a result of a
	larger overall increase in production volumes between the two periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Depreciation, depletion and amortization ("DD&amp;A").
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DD&amp;A increased to approximately $97.4&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2010 from $58.0&nbsp;million at
	December&nbsp;31, 2009, an increase of $39.4&nbsp;million, or 68%. The following table provides components of our DD&amp;A expense for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 2009.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	increase in depletion of proved oil and natural gas properties of approximately $38.4&nbsp;million and the increase in the depletion rate of $2.46 per BOE were due largely to additions to the
	full cost pool related to our increase in drilling in 2011 as compared to 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	increase in depreciation for pipeline and gas gathering assets of approximately $0.5&nbsp;million was primarily due to the expansion of our gas gathering system.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	increase in depreciation for other fixed assets of approximately $0.5&nbsp;million was primarily due to an increase in fixed asset additions as we grew the company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Impairment expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We evaluate the impairment of our oil and gas properties on a quarterly basis according to the full cost method prescribed by the SEC. If the
	carrying amount exceeds the calculated full cost ceiling, we reduce the carrying amount of the oil and gas properties to the calculated full cost ceiling amount, which is determined to be their
	estimated fair value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	68
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=9,SEQ=73,EFW="2211287",CP="LAREDO PETROLEUM HOLDINGS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=407307,FOLIO='68',FILE='DISK130:[12ZCQ1.12ZCQ19101]DK19101A.;42',USER='ANEETZ',CD=';4-OCT-2012;22:12' -->
<A NAME="A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DK19101_1_69">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_BG19101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Impairment
	expense at December&nbsp;31, 2009 reflects the impairment of our oil and gas properties of approximately $245.9&nbsp;million due to declining market prices for oil and gas, and the
	write-down to lower of cost of market of our materials and supplies of approximately $0.8&nbsp;million, consisting of pipe and well equipment, due to declining market prices. For oil and
	natural gas assets, the full cost ceiling calculation was computed using the unweighted arithmetic average first-day-of-the-month prices for the
	12-months ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 of $57.04 per Bbl for oil and $3.15 per MMBtu for natural gas, adjusted for energy content, transportation fees and regional price differentials.
	It was determined that oil and natural gas properties were not impaired for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 as their carrying amount did not exceed the calculated full cost ceiling.
	Additionally, a write-down of our materials and supplies was not necessary at December&nbsp;31, 2010 based on our lower of cost or market analysis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Commodity derivative financial instruments.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Due to the inherent volatility in oil and gas prices,
	we use commodity derivative instruments including puts, swaps, collars, and basis swaps to hedge future price risk associated with a significant portion of our anticipated oil and gas production. At
	each period end, we estimate the fair value of our commodity derivatives and recognize an unrealized gain or loss. We have not elected hedge accounting on these derivatives, therefore, the unrealized
	gains and losses on open positions are reflected in current earnings. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 2009, our hedges resulted in realized gains of approximately $22.7&nbsp;million
	and $52.1&nbsp;million, respectively. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 2009, our hedges resulted in unrealized losses of approximately $11.5&nbsp;million and $46.4&nbsp;million,
	respectively. During 2009, some of our hedge contracts matured and commodity prices began to recover, creating an unrealized loss at December&nbsp;31, 2009. During 2010, we entered into a number of
	new commodity derivatives of which seven had associated deferred premiums totaling approximately $13.4&nbsp;million. The estimated fair value of our total deferred premiums was approximately
	$12.5&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2010. The fair market value of these premiums is deducted from our unrealized gains and losses and largely accounts for the overall unrealized loss on
	commodity derivatives at December&nbsp;31, 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Interest expense and realized and unrealized gains and losses on interest rate derivatives.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest expense increased to approximately $18.5&nbsp;million for
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 from $7.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, largely due to a higher weighted average interest rate and a higher weighted average
	outstanding debt balance on the Broad Oak credit facility and the issuance of our term loan during 2010 as compared to 2009. Additionally, we had approximately $2.0&nbsp;million in amortized
	deferred loan costs and $0.4&nbsp;million in other fees and deferred premium amortization that were charged to interest expense for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 as compared to
	$0.6&nbsp;million in amortized deferred loan costs and an insignificant amount of other fees and amortization for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_34"></A>

<!-- ZEQ.=10,SEQ=74,EFW="2211287",CP="LAREDO PETROLEUM HOLDINGS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=814302,FOLIO='69',FILE='DISK130:[12ZCQ1.12ZCQ19101]DK19101A.;42',USER='ANEETZ',CD=';4-OCT-2012;22:12' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DL19101_1_70">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_BG19101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During 2010 and 2009, we entered into certain variable-to-fixed interest rate derivatives that hedge our exposure to interest rate variations on our
	variable interest rate debt. At December&nbsp;31, 2010, we had interest rate swaps and caps outstanding for a notional amount of $300.0&nbsp;million with fixed pay rates ranging from 1.11% to
	3.41% and terms expiring from June 2011 to September 2013 compared to outstanding swaps for a notional amount of $180.0&nbsp;million with fixed pay rates ranging from 1.60% to 3.41% and terms
	expiring from June 2011 to June 2012 at December&nbsp;31, 2009. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, we realized a loss on interest rate derivatives of approximately $5.2&nbsp;million
	compared to a realized loss of $3.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009. Additionally, we recorded an unrealized loss on interest rate derivatives of approximately
	$0.1&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2010 compared to an unrealized gain of $0.4&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2009. At December&nbsp;31, 2010, the estimated fair value of our
	interest rate derivatives was in a net liability position of approximately $5.5&nbsp;million compared to a net liability position of $5.6&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2009.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Income tax expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We recorded a deferred income tax benefit of approximately $25.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, compared to a
	deferred income tax benefit of
	approximately $74.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009. At December&nbsp;31, 2009, we recognized a deferred income tax benefit for the impairment of our oil and gas
	properties of approximately $86.1&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Additionally,
	we recorded a valuation allowance of approximately $0.7&nbsp;million against our Texas deferred tax asset at December&nbsp;31, 2010, as we believe it is more likely than not that we
	will not realize a future benefit for the full amount of our Texas deferred tax asset. The estimated annual effective tax rate was 37% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 35% for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2009. Our annual effective tax rate is based on our estimated annual permanent tax differences and estimated annual pre-tax book income. Our estimates involve
	assumptions we believe to be reasonable at the time of the estimation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During
	the fourth quarter of 2010, we determined that it was more likely than not that the remaining federal net operating loss carry-forwards and net federal deferred assets would be realized.
	Consideration given included estimated future net cash flows from oil and gas reserves (including the timing of those cash flows) and the future tax effect of the deferred tax assets and liabilities
	recorded at December&nbsp;31, 2010. As a result of this determination, the valuation allowance was released against the deferred tax assets, resulting in a decrease of the valuation allowance by
	approximately $47.9&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, we increased the valuation allowance against Broad Oak's net federal deferred tax asset by approximately $16.5&nbsp;million and decreased the valuation
	allowance against Broad Oak's Louisiana deferred tax by approximately $0.1&nbsp;million. We believed it was more likely than not that we would not realize a future benefit for the full amount of the
	federal and Louisiana net deferred tax asset as of December&nbsp;31, 2009.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=3>
<B>
	Liquidity and capital resources
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our primary sources of liquidity have been capital contributions from Warburg Pincus, certain members of our management and our board
	of directors, borrowings on our senior secured credit facility, proceeds from the 2019 senior unsecured notes and the 2022 senior unsecured notes, borrowings on the prior Broad Oak credit facility,
	borrowings on our prior term loan
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	70
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=75,EFW="2211287",CP="LAREDO PETROLEUM HOLDINGS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=952145,FOLIO='70',FILE='DISK130:[12ZCQ1.12ZCQ19101]DL19101A.;30',USER='ANEETZ',CD=';4-OCT-2012;22:12' -->
<A NAME="A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DL19101_1_71">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_BG19101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	facility,
	proceeds from our IPO and cash flows from operations. Our primary use of capital has been for the exploration, development and acquisition of oil and gas properties. As we pursue reserves
	and production growth, we continually consider which capital resources, including equity and debt financings, are available to meet our future financial obligations, planned capital expenditure
	activities and liquidity requirements. Our future ability to grow proved reserves and production will be highly dependent on the capital resources available to us. We believe that we have significant
	liquidity available to us from cash flow from operations and on our senior secured credit facility for our planned exploration and development activities. In addition, our hedge positions currently
	provide relative certainty on a majority of our cash flows from operations through 2014 even with the general decline in the prices of natural gas.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	At
	June&nbsp;30, 2012, we had no debt outstanding and approximately $0.03&nbsp;million of outstanding letters of credit on our senior secured credit facility. Additionally, we had
	$1.05&nbsp;billion of outstanding senior unsecured notes, excluding the remaining premium of $1.9&nbsp;million received on the October 2011 offering of our 2019 senior unsecured notes. We had
	approximately $785.0&nbsp;million available for borrowings on our senior secured credit facility and $146.5&nbsp;million in cash on hand for total available liquidity of approximately
	$931.5&nbsp;million at June&nbsp;30, 2012. We believe such availability as well as cash flows from operations provide us with the ability to implement our planned exploration and development
	activities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As
	of September&nbsp;30, 2012, we had approximately $50.0&nbsp;million in outstanding borrowings on our senior secured credit facility and approximately $735.0&nbsp;million available for
	borrowings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	expect that, in the future, our commodity derivative positions will help us stabilize a portion of our expected cash flows from operations despite potential declines in the price of oil and gas.
	Please see "&#151;Quantitative and qualitative disclosures about market risk" below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=3>
<B>
	Cash flows
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our cash flows for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 and 2011 and the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2011, 2010 and 2009 are
	as follows:
</FONT>
</P>

<TH STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Cash flows provided by operating activities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Net cash provided by operating activities was $199.8&nbsp;million and $162.1&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 and 2011,
	respectively. The increase of $37.7&nbsp;million was largely due to increases in revenue due to increased production.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Net
	cash provided by operating activities was $344.1&nbsp;million, $157.0&nbsp;million and $112.7&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2011, 2010 and 2009, respectively. The
	increases of
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	71
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=76,EFW="2211287",CP="LAREDO PETROLEUM HOLDINGS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=532209,FOLIO='71',FILE='DISK130:[12ZCQ1.12ZCQ19101]DL19101A.;30',USER='ANEETZ',CD=';4-OCT-2012;22:12' -->
<A NAME="A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_PAGE_DL19101_1_72">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2211287ZS-1A_HTM_BG19101A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	$187.1&nbsp;million
	from 2010 to 2011 and $44.3&nbsp;million from 2009 to 2010 were largely due to significant increases in revenue due to our successful drilling program, as well as an increase
	in the market price for oil.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	operating cash flows are sensitive to a number of variables, the most significant of which are production levels and the volatility of oil and gas prices. Regional and worldwide economic activity,
	weather, infrastructure, capacity to reach markets, costs of operations and other variable factors significantly impact the prices of these commodities. These factors are not within our control and
	are difficult to predict. For additional information on the impact of changing prices on our financial position, see "&#151;Quantitative and qualitative disclosures about market risk."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Cash flows used in investing activities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We used cash flows in investing activities of approximately $485.8&nbsp;million and $359.4&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30,
	2012 and 2011, respectively, which is an increase of $126.4&nbsp;million. A portion of our capital expenditures for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 reflects expenditures which were accrued
	for at December&nbsp;31, 2011 as part of our 2011 capital budget, but due to the timing of when billings were received, were paid during the first quarter of 2012. Additionally, a significant
	portion of the increase was due to increasing our drilling efforts in our Permian Basin and Anadarko Granite Wash areas as we continue to explore and develop our identified potential drilling
	locations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We
	used cash flows in investing activities of approximately $706.8&nbsp;million, $460.5&nbsp;million and $361.3&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2011, 2010 and 2009,
	respectively. The increases of $246.3&nbsp;million from 2010 to 2011 and $99.2&nbsp;million from 2009 to 2010 are due to increasing our drilling efforts in our Permian Basin and Anadarko Granite
	Wash areas in order to take advantage of strategic vertical and horizontal drilling and improving commodity prices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	cash used in investing activities for capital expenditures for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 and 2011 and the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2011, 2010 and 2009 is summarized in the
	table below.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_36"></A>
